intro: Josephinia eugeniae, commonly known as the Josephine's eugenia, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and requires high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
